title: Circuits - Time constant of RC circuit

content.description: A variable resistor initially of resistance <math alttext="R sub 0" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> is connected in series to a parallel-plate capacitor and a battery, as shown. The initial separation of the capacitor plates is <math alttext="d sub 0" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>d</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>. The circuit initially has a time constant <math alttext="tau sub 0" overflow="scroll"> <msub> <mi>τ</mi> <mn>0</mn> </msub> </math>. The resistance of the resistor and the capacitor plate separation are then changed.
content.question: Which of the following combinations of resistance and plate separation would result in a time constant equal to <math alttext="tau sub 0" overflow="scroll"> <msub> <mi>τ</mi> <mn>0</mn> </msub> </math>?
